title: 2015 Talladega: NTS Motorsports NASCAR Truck Race Preview - PaddockTalk
text: Posted by: newsla on Oct 21, 2015 - 06:13 AM 2015 Talladega: NTS Motorsports NASCAR Truck Race Preview Wild Card On The Boulevard...The NASCAR Camping World Truck Series (NCWTS) heads into its final five-race stretch at the biggest and baddest track on the 2015 schedule, Talladega Superspeedway, where Daniel Hemric will be making his first start at the 2.66-mile track. The Sunoco Rookie of the Year candidate has only one previous superspeedway start, coming in the season-opener at Daytona International Speedway, where a mid-race wreck relegated him to a 26th-place finish. All-American Winner...No matter what happens at Talladega Superspeedway, Hemric has already earned some new hardware this week. The Kannapolis native took the checkered flag and the prized guitar trophy in the prestigious All American 400 Pro Late Model race at Tennessee's Fairgrounds Speedway Nashville on Sunday. A Flood Of Support...This weekend, Hemric will carry the Salvation Army logo in support of South Carolina flood relief on the hood, TV panel and tonneau cover of the No. 14 Chevrolet Silverado. The Salvation Army operates 7,546 centers in communities across the United States. These include food distribution, disaster relief, rehabilitation centers, anti-human trafficking efforts, and a wealth of children's programs. To donate to relief efforts, visit www.SCFlood.org. Super (Speedway) Clean...In addition to the Salvation Army's South Carolina flood relief, the No. 14 Chevy Silverado will be sporting the bright colors of California Clean Power at Talladega Superspeedway. Community Choice Aggregation has become an integral part of California's strategy to achieve its climate change goals. California Clean Power is the leader in providing cities and counties all the tools to start and run their own local CCA energy program from funding to customer service, bringing savings to their energy bills, more renewable energy, funding for local projects and local control back to the community. For more information visit www.cacleanpower.com. Chassis Info...The No. 14 NTS Motorsports team will unload chassis NTS-7 for this weekend's event at Talladega Superspeedway. This chassis was raced to a third-place finish by Scott Lagasse, Jr. in the season-opening event at Daytona International Speedway. Previous Race Recap...Hemric and his NTS Motorsports team beat the odds in his Las Vegas debut, earning a top-10 finish in the NCWTS' only trip of the season to Las Vegas Motor Speedway. Hemric overcame a loose-handling truck and going a lap down in the Rhino Linings 350, earning his lap back on the racetrack and advancing to sixth before crossing the start/finish line. Come Say Hi...Meet Hemric and the other Truck Series stars at the Talladega Superspeedway autograph session on Friday, October 23 from 4:00-4:45 p.m. at the Hospitality Village behind Birmingham Tower. Watch and Listen...The Fred's 250 can be seen live on Saturday, October 24 on FOX with coverage beginning at 1:00 p.m. EDT. The event can also be heard live on MRN Radio and SiriusXM Satellite Radio. Vote Early and Often...The polls are open for the 2015 NCWTS Most Popular Driver. Fans can vote once per day from now until the checkered flag waves at Homestead-Miami Speedway on Friday, November 20. PaddockTalk Perspective
